gurmukhi: paun rhXO aurJwie GrI iek nIr ndI ko cly su kCU nw ] jy biRjBwmn AweI huqI Dr Kwsn AMg ibKY Aru JUnw ]
transliteration: Paoun Rahyau Urjhaae Ghariik Neer Nadiko Chale Su Kachhodh Naa|| Je Brij-bhaamanndaaihoutidhar Khaasan An Bikhai Ar(u) Jhoonaa||
translation: For one ghari (a short while), the wind got entangled and the water of the river did not proceed further; heart-throbs of all the women of Braja, who cam there, had increased and the limbs were trembling;

gurmukhi: so sun kY Dun bwsurI kI qn bIc rhI iqn ky suD hU nw ] qw suD gI sur ky sun hI rhgI ieh mwnhu icqR nmUnw ]639]
transliteration: So Soun Kai Dhoun Baasurikitan Beech Rahitin Ke Sudh Hoo Naa|| Taa Sudh Gisur Ke Soun Hirahgieh Maanoh Chitraa Namoondaa||639||
translation: They lost the consciousness of their body completely; they all became mere portraits on listening to the flute.639.

gurmukhi: rIJ bjwvq hY murlI hir pY mn mY kir SMk kCU nw ] jw kI suny Dun sRaunn mY kr ky Kg Awvq hY bn sUnw ]
transliteration: Reejh Bajaavat Hai Murlihar(i) Pai Man Mai Kar(i) Shank Kachhodh Naa|| Jaa Kisoune Dhoun Sraounan Mai Kar Ke Khag Aavat Hai Ban Soonaa||
translation: Krishna taking the flute in his hand is fearlessly playing on it and listening to its voice, the birds of the forest, deserting it, are coming away;

gurmukhi: so sun gÍwrin rIJ mn BIqr SMk krI kChU nw ] nYn pswr rhI ipK kY ijm GMtk hyr bjy imil mUnw ]640]
transliteration: So Soun Gvaaran(i) Reejh Rahiman Bheetar Shank Karikachh-hoo|| Nain Pasaar Pikh Kai Jim Ghantak Her Bade Mil(i0 Maanaa||640||
translation: The gopis are also pleased on listening it and are becoming fearless; just as on listening to the voice of the horn, the doe of the black deer becomes spell-bound, in the same way, on listening to the flute, the gopis are standing wonder-struks, with mout

gurmukhi: sur bwsurI kI kib sXwm khY muK kwnr ky Aiq hI su rsI hY ] sorT dyv gMDwr ibBws iblwvl hU kI su qwn bsI hY ]
transliteration: Sur Baasurikikabisyaam Kahai Moukh Kaanar Ke At(i) Hisu Rasihai|| Sorath Dev Gaddhaar Bidhaas Bilaaval Hoo Kisu Taan Basihai||
translation: The tune of the flute from the mounth of Krishna is highly impressive and withing it abide the tunes of the kmusical modes of Sorath, Devgandhar, Vibhas and Bilawal;

gurmukhi: kMcn so ijh ko qn hY ijh ky muK kI sm soB ssI hY ] qw ky bjwieby kO sun kY miq gÍwrin kI iqh bIc PsI hY ]641]
transliteration: Kanchanndso Jih Ko Tan Hai Jih Ke Moukh Kisam Sobh Sasihai|| Taa Ke Bajaae-be Kau Soun Kai Mat(i) Gvaaran(i) Kitih Beech Phasihai||641||
translation: The body of Krishna is like gold and the Glory of the face is like that of the moon, listening to the tune of the flute, the mind of the gopis has only remained entangled teherein.641.

gurmukhi: dyvgMDwr ibBws iblwvl swrMg kI Dun qwN mY bsweI ] sorT su`D mlwr ikDO sur mwlisrI kI mhw suKdweI ]
transliteration: Devgaddhaar Bibhaas Bilaaval Saaran Kiduoun Taan Mai Basaaee|| Sorath Suddh Malaar Kidhau Sur Maalsirikimahaa Soukhdaat||
translation: The peace-giving tune is being played n the flute concerning the musical modes of Devgandhari, Vibhas, Bilawal, Sarang Sorath, Shuddh Malhar and Malshri;

gurmukhi: moih rhy sB hI sur Aau nr gÍwrn rIJ rhI sun DweI ] XO aupjI sr cytk kI Bgvwn mno Dr Pws clweI ]642]
transliteration: Moh(i) Rahe Sabh Hisur Au Nar Gvaaran Reejh Rahisoun Dhaaee|| Yau Oupjisur Chetak Kibhagvaan Mano Dhar Phaas Chadhaaee||
translation: Hearing it, all the gods and men, getting pleased, are running and they are bewitched by the tune with such intensity that they seem to have been entrapped in some noose of love spread by Krishna.642.

gurmukhi: Awnn hY ijh ko Aiq suMdr kMD Dry joaU hY pt pIlo ] jwih mrXo AG nwm bfo irpu qwq rKXo Aih qy ijn lIlo ]
transliteration: Oonan Hai Jih Ko At(i) Soundar Kandh Ddare Jooo Hai Pat Peelo|| Jaah(i) Daryo Agh Naam Bado Rip(u) Taat Takhyo Ah(i) Te Jin Leelo||
translation: He, whose face is extremely beautiful and who has put on yellow cloth on his shoulders; he, who destroyed the demon Aghasura and who had protected his elders from the mouth of the snake;

gurmukhi: AswDn kO isr jo ktIXw Aru swDn ko hrqw joaU hIlo ] cor lXo sur so mn qws bjwie BlI ibiD swQ rsIlo ]643]
transliteration: Asaadhan Kau Sir Jo Kateeyaa Ar(u) Saadhan Ko Hartaa Jooo Heelo|| Chor Layo Sur So Man Taas Bajaae Bhalibidh(i) Saath Raeelo||643||
translation: He who is the destroyer of the tyrants and remover of the sufferings of the saints, that Krishna, playing on his savoury flute, has allured the mind of gods.643.

gurmukhi: jwih BBICn rwj dXo Ar rwvn jwih mrXo kir kRohY ] ckR ky swQ ikDo ijnhU isspwl ko sIs ktXo kr CohY ]
transliteration: Jaah(i) Bhabheechhan Raaj Dayo Ar Raavan Jaah(i) Daryo Kar(i) Krohai|| Chakra Ke Saath Kidho Jinhoo Seespaal Ko Sees Katyo Kar Chhodhai||
translation: He, who gave kingdom to Vibhishna, killed Ravana in great rage, who cut off the head of Shishupal with his disc;

gurmukhi: mYn su Aau isX ko Brqw ijh mUrq kI sm qu`il n ko hY ] so kr lY Apny murlI Ab suMdr goipn ky mn mohY ]644]
transliteration: Main Su Au Siya Ko Bhartaa Jih Moondat Kisam Tull(i) Na Ko Hai|| So Kar Lai Apne Murliab Soundar Gopin Ke Man Mohai||644||
translation: Who is beautiful like the god of love and who is Ram, the husband of Sita, who is unequalled in beauty by anyone, that Krishna with his flute in his hands, is now fascinating the mind of charming gopis.644.
